meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a scepter.
meanings.sent1: The king held a sceptral staff during the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The queen's sceptral crown sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The sceptral umbrella made everyone laugh at the royal picnic.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a sceptral quality that commanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The sceptral glow of the chandelier lit up the grand hall.

meanings.definition: Resembling or having the form of a scepter.
meanings.sent1: The wizard's wand had a sceptral appearance.
meanings.sent2: The tree branches formed a sceptral shape against the sky.
meanings.sent3: The sceptral pen on the desk seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: His gaze was fixed on the sceptral silhouette in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The old gate had a sceptral design that added to its charm.
